info.name: OOONA Tools User API üë§
info.description: The OOONA Tools API can be used to convert subtitle files and run automatic QC on subtitle and caption files.

item.name: üîë Authentication

request.description:
Generate an authorization token.

The respone body withh containt the access_token which goes into the Authorization header containing "Bearer " + access_token for any other API call.

item.description:
All API requests must contain an `Authorization` header with a bearer token constructed with a `"Bearer "` prefix together with the `access_token` generated using the [/token](#2a82c7cd-8af7-4c1b-85bf-f521c578a043) endpoint. To get a token, make a request to [/token](#2a82c7cd-8af7-4c1b-85bf-f521c578a043) with the `name`, `key`, `client_id` and `client_secret` you will be provided with.

It‚Äôs up to you to decide if you want to generate a different token for every request or cache the token until the `‚Äú.expires‚Äù` value and generate a new token as soon as it expires (or soon before).

item.name: üìÑ Convert

request.description:
Convert a file from one format to another (or from one configuration to another).

The URL contains the input configuration name or id and the export configuration name or id.

- **"offset"** is used for timecode offset, e.g. ?offset=30.5 to  
    offset by 30.5 seconds or ?offset=-10 to offset backwards by 10 seconds.
    
- **"startTC"** is used to override the media start timecode  
    value of the source file, e.g. ?startTC=01:00:00:00 to start at 1 hour or  
    ?startTC=3600 to start at 1 hour for non drop-frame file.
    
- **"addSegments"** is used to add portions to the output  
    file offsetting the following subtitles accordingly. e.g. ?addSegments=700.00-720.00,1214-1250.5
    
- "**keepSegments**" is a comma separated list of segments to keep. e.g. 0-903.84,1180-2550.5
    
- "**validate**" will fail the conversion if the output file will fail basic validation for import, missing timecodes, out of sequence subtitles or 0 duration. Otherwise, the same validation will run but will not fail the conversion with a 400 error (the errors will be returned in the ooona-warnings response header).
    
- "**fixDuration**" is an integer frame count that defines subtitles minimum duration. If this is set, all subtitles with a duration below this value will be updated to have an out-cue that conforms to the minimum duration as long as they don't overlap with the minimum timing gap before the next subtitle.
    
- "**ignoreWarnings**" will remove the response header "ooona-warnings" that's included in every convert response and includes a list of conversion warnings.

- **"offset"** is used for timecode offset, e.g. ?offset=30.5 to offset by 30.5 seconds or  
    ?offset=-10 to offset backwards by 10 seconds.
    
- **"removeSegments"** is used to delete portions of the output file offsetting the following subtitles  
    accordingly. Subtitles within the removed segments will be deleted and  
    subtitles with partial overlap with the removed segment will be truncated. e.g.  
    ?removeSegments=549.13-603.84,1180-1250.5 to adjust the subtitles file to a new  
    video file that no longer contains the segments from second 549.13 to 603.84  
    and from second 1180 to 1250.5.
    
- **"addSegments"** is used to add new empty segments to the output  
    file. e.g. ?addSegments=549.13-603.84,1180-1250.5 to add empty segments from  
    second 549.13 to 603.84 and from second 1180 to 1250.5 to the output file. The  
    first seconds value is the timecode in the current file to add the segment and  
    the second value is that same timecode added to the desired segment duration.  
    Do not offset the segments by adding the duration of the former segments - it's  
    done automatically.

Stitch multiple files together.

_/external/stitch/{importConfigurationId}/{exportConfigurationId}_

The body of the request should contain all input files for the process. Here are the optional query strings parameters you can provide:

- keepSegments ‚Äì a pipe separated list of keepSegments list. The order of the lists should be the same as the order of the files.  
    e.g. 3609-3625|3631-3633|3633-3650
    
- offsets ‚Äì a pipe separated list of offset values for each file. The order of the lists should be the same as the order of the files. If keepSegments is not provided ‚Äì you must provide the offsets list.  
    e.g. for 3 files where each is for a one hour video and you didn‚Äôt provide keepSegments for, you can specify: 0|3600|7200
    
- offset ‚Äì an optional offset value to apply to the output file.
    

Both offsets and keepSegments are optional ‚Äì but you have to specify one of them ‚Äì otherwise, we won‚Äôt be able to guess the length of the video and won‚Äôt know how to stich the input files.

request.description:
Send a POST request with a file to run a list of fixes on the file.  
Can run with or without import and export template ids in the link (either "/external/qc" or "/external/conform/IMPORT_TEMPLATE_ID/EXPORT_TEMPLATE_ID" or "/external/conform/FORMAT_KEY/FORMAT_KEY" with the input file and output format keys which will use default settings). The input and output formats must be the same - you cannot convert a file during a conform.

FORMAT_KEY is the file format key (all file formats and their keys are available in the [/external/formats](#215faf46-7890-4f0f-9984-2f1b79d02dd4) endpoint)

The body of the request must be of the form-data type with file to fix and a fixes JSON object like following: {"test_name1":"test_value1", "test_name2":"test_value2"}.

Availiable fixes:

| Key | Name | Description | Value Type | Sample Value |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| **duration** | Minimum Duration Fix | Adjust all subtitles to comply with minimum duration as long as they don't overlap. | Number - seconds value | 0.48 |
| **gap** | Timing Gap Fix | Conform all subtitles within a certain gap to an exact timing gap. | A string of 2 integers "X/Y" - X is the desired frame gap and Y is the maximum frame gap to snap to the desired value. If X is supplied without a Y the default Y value is X\*3 | "2/8" |
